This is the sort of thing that all of my favourite teachers have taught me regarding getting things done. That if you wait for the perfect moment then you'll end up waiting forever. Or even worse if you get caught up imagining that you need extra gear or some kind of technology you don't have access to then your need for a better camera or computer or synthesiser becomes yet another excuse to not make something. So instead you try to use the limiting factors or the chaos factors as part of whatever it is you are creating instead of attempting some kind of escape or waiting for things to quiet down. Sometimes it works sometimes it doesn't but to me I've begun to imagine that it's a good sign when at the very moment I try to make something there appears some kind of pushback or problem to
